answers.answer: Hi,Your symptoms do not seem to be due to menopause. They car be more likely to be due to anaemia, vitamin deficiency, chronic fatigue etc. Haemoglobin levels need to be checked and also you should rule out diabetes can hypertension. The giddiness can be due to low sugar levels, low blood pressure or problems of the inner ear. Consult a physician for an evaluation.The answer is based on information provided. Exact advice is not possible without a proper examination and investigations. You are requested to consult your Doctor. Take care and keep us posted.

question: I had an abdominal hysterectomy 4 years ago - I have no female parts left - no ovaries, cervix, etc.  I'm feeling kind a weird lately.  Dry eyes, blurred vision, heavy eyes/like saran wrap on them, burning tongue, loss of balance, feel like I'm going to fall down when I'm walking, weak muscles.  On the flip side, I have a lot of energy during the day but I still yawn all day as well.  I take Progest cream, D3, Magnesium, Zinc, EFA's, Probiotics, Calcium and Kyo-Green powder.  I've been to the eye doctor and he said just get a pair of readers.  I'm not really into Western medicine since my surgery so I'm doing the homeopathic/natural stuff.  I'm almost 44 years old and not sure if I already went through menopause or if this is it.  I don't have night sweats or headaches or any pains either.   I sleep like a baby and get about 6-8 hours on average a night.  Is there anyone out there that feels like I do?
title: Hysterectomy 4 years ago - am I in menopause?
